text:
A Trinamool Congress leader was on Sunday detained by the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) at Kolkata airport for attempting to board a Chennai-bound flight with an unlicensed gun, police said.

Naren Chakraborty, Pandabeshwar Block Trinamool president, had boarded a chopper from Andal airport and landed in NSCB airport here in the afternoon, the police said, adding that he was scheduled to leave the city for Chennai on a SpiceJet flight in the evening.

“CISF detained Chakraborty at the check-in point after it was found that he was carrying a gun and some cartridges but had no arms licence. The CISF handed him over. We are investigating the case,” said a senior police officer at Airport police station. — PTI
title: Trinamool leader detained at airport for carrying unlicensed gun
